maml:description.maml:para: Adds a user to a JIRA group
This function adds a JIRA user to a JIRA group.

maml:Description.maml:para: Group (or list of groups) to which the user(s) will be added.
Username or user object obtained from Get-JiraUser.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Group (or list of groups) to which the user(s) will be added.
Username or user object obtained from Get-JiraUser.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.Group[]] Group(s) to which users should be added
If the -PassThru parameter is provided, this function will provide a

maml:description.maml:para: reference to the JIRA group modified. Otherwise, this function does not provide output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This REST method is still marked Experimental in JIRA's REST API. That means that there is a high probability this will break in future versions of JIRA. The function will need to be re-written at that time.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds the user jsmith to the group testUsers
This example illustrates the use of the pipeline to add jsmith to the "Project Admins" group in JIRA.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a comment to an existing JIRA issue
This function adds a comment to an existing issue in JIRA. You can optionally set the visibility of the comment (All Users, Developers, or Administrators).

maml:Description.maml:para: Comment that should be added to JIRA.
Issue that should be commented upon.
Visibility of the comment - should it be publicly visible, viewable to only developers, or only administrators?
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Comment that should be added to JIRA.
Issue that should be commented upon.
Visibility of the comment - should it be publicly visible, viewable to only developers, or only administrators?
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: This function can accept JiraPS.Issue objects via pipeline.
This function outputs the JiraPS.Comment object created.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds a simple comment to the issue TEST-001.
This example illustrates pipeline use from Get-JiraIssue to Add-JiraIssueComment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: = -5d' | % { Add-JiraIssueComment "This issue has been cancelled per Vice President's orders." }

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example illustrates commenting on all projects which match a given JQL query. It would be best to validate the query first to make sure the query returns the expected issues!

Add-JiraIssueComment $c -Issue TEST-003 This example illustrates adding a comment based on other logic to a JIRA issue. Note the use of Format-Jira to convert the output of Get-Process into a format that is easily read by users.

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a link between two Issues on Jira
Creates a new link of the specified type between two Issue.

maml:Description.maml:para: Issue key or JiraPS.Issue object returned from Get-JiraIssue
Issue Link to be created.
Write a comment to the issue
Credentials to use to connect to Jira ,
[Switch] $PassThru
Issue key or JiraPS.Issue object returned from Get-JiraIssue
Issue Link to be created.
Write a comment to the issue
Credentials to use to connect to Jira ,
[Switch] $PassThru

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.Issue[]] The JIRA issue that should be linked

maml:description.maml:para: [JiraPS.IssueLink[]] The JIRA issue link that should be used

dev:remarks.maml:para: outwardIssue = [PSCustomObject]@{key = "TEST-10"} type = [PSCustomObject]@{name = "Composition"} } Add-JiraIssueLink -Issue TEST-01 -IssueLink $link Creates a link "is part of" between TEST-01 and TEST-10

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a watcher to an existing JIRA issue
This function adds a watcher to an existing issue in JIRA.

maml:Description.maml:para: Watcher that should be added to JIRA
Issue that should be watched
Credentials to use to connect to Jira. If not specified, this function will use
Watcher that should be added to JIRA
Issue that should be watched
Credentials to use to connect to Jira. If not specified, this function will use

dev:type.maml:name: This function can accept JiraPS.Issue objects via pipeline.
This function does not provide output.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds a watcher to the issue TEST-001.
This example illustrates pipeline use from Get-JiraIssue to Add-JiraIssueWatcher.
This example illustrates adding watcher on all projects which match a given JQL query. It would be best to validate the query first to make sure the query returns the expected issues!

maml:description.maml:para: Adds a worklog item to an existing JIRA issue
This function adds a worklog item to an existing issue in JIRA. You can optionally set the visibility of the item (All Users, Developers, or Administrators).

maml:Description.maml:para: Worklog item that should be added to JIRA
Issue to receive the new worklog item
Time spent to be logged
Date/time started to be logged
Visibility of the comment - should it be publicly visible, viewable to only developers, or only administrators?
Credentials to use to connect to Jira. If not specified, this function will use
Worklog item that should be added to JIRA
Issue to receive the new worklog item
Time spent to be logged
Date/time started to be logged
Visibility of the comment - should it be publicly visible, viewable to only developers, or only administrators?
Credentials to use to connect to Jira. If not specified, this function will use

dev:type.maml:name: This function can accept JiraPS.Issue objects via pipeline.
This function outputs the JiraPS.Worklogitem object created.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds a simple worklog item to the issue TEST-001.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-JiraIssue "TEST-002" | Add-JiraIssueWorklog "Test worklog item from PowerShell" -TimeSpent 60 -DateStarted (Get-Date)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example illustrates pipeline use from Get-JiraIssue to Add-JiraIssueWorklog.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: = -5d' | % { Add-JiraIssueWorklog "This issue has been cancelled per Vice President's orders." -TimeSpent 60 -DateStarted (Get-Date)}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example illustrates logging work on all projects which match a given JQL query. It would be best to validate the query first to make sure the query returns the expected issues!

Add-JiraIssueWorklog $c -Issue TEST-003 -TimeSpent 60 -DateStarted (Get-Date) This example illustrates adding a comment based on other logic to a JIRA issue. Note the use of Format-Jira to convert the output of Get-Process into a format that is easily read by users.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts an object into a table formatted according to JIRA's markdown syntax
This function converts a PowerShell object into a table using JIRA's markdown syntax. This can then be added to a JIRA issue description or comment.
Like the native Format-* cmdlets, this is a destructive operation, so as always, remember to "filter left, format right!"

maml:Description.maml:para: List of properties to display. If omitted, only the default properties will be shown.
To display all properties, use -Property *.
Object to format.
List of properties to display. If omitted, only the default properties will be shown.
To display all properties, use -Property *.
Object to format.

maml:alert.maml:para: This is a destructive operation, since it permanently reduces InputObjects to Strings. Remember to "filter left, format right."

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example illustrates converting the output from Get-Process into a JIRA table, which is then added as a comment to issue TEST-001.
This example obtains all Google Chrome processes, then creates a JIRA table with only the Name,ID, and VM properties of each object.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a Component from Jira

This function returns information regarding a specified component from Jira. If -InputObject is given via parameter or pipe all components for the given project are returned. It is not possible to get all components with this function.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Project ID or project key of a project to search.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
The Component ID.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
The Project ID or project key of a project to search.
The Component ID.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

maml:description.maml:para: [PSCredential] Credentials to use to connect to Jira

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns information about the component with ID 10000
Returns information about the component with ID 20000
Returns information about all components within project 'Project1'
Return information about all components within projects 'ABC' and 'DEF'

maml:description.maml:para: Obtains the configured URL for the JIRA server
This function returns the configured URL for the JIRA server that JiraPS should manipulate. By default, this is stored in a config.xml file at the module's root path.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to the configuration file, if not the default.
Path to the configuration file, if not the default.

dev:type.maml:name: This function does not accept pipeline input.

maml:alert.maml:para: Support for multiple configuration files is limited at this point in time, but enhancements are planned for a future update.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the server URL of the JIRA server configured in the JiraPS config file.
Returns the server URL of the JIRA server configured at C:\jiraconfig.xml.

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns information about JIRA fields
This function provides information about JIRA fields, or about one field in particular. This is a good way to identify a field's ID by its name, or vice versa.
Typically, this information is only needed when identifying what fields are necessary to create or edit issues. See Get-JiraIssueCreateMetadata for more details.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Field name or ID to search.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
The Field name or ID to search.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: This function does not accept pipeline input.
This function outputs the JiraPS.Field object(s) that represent the JIRA field(s).

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns information about all JIRA fields visible to the current user (or using anonymous access if a JiraPS session has not been defined).
This example returns information about the IssueKey field.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns information about a filter in JIRA
This function returns information about a filter in JIRA, including the JQL syntax of the filter, its owner, and sharing status.

This function is only capable of returning filters by their Filter ID. This is a limitation of JIRA's REST API. The easiest way to obtain the ID of a filter is to load the filter in the "regular" Web view of JIRA, then copy the ID from the URL of the page.

maml:Description.maml:para: ID of the filter to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Object of the filter to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
ID of the filter to search for.
Object of the filter to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: [Object[]] The filter to look up in JIRA. This can be a String (filter ID) or a JiraPS.Filter object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets a reference to filter ID 12345 from JIRA
Gets the information of a filter by providing a filter object

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a group from Jira
This function returns information regarding a specified group from JIRA.
By default, this function does not display members of the group. This is JIRA's default behavior as well. To display group members, use Get-JiraGroupMember.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the group to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Object of the group to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Name of the group to search for.
Object of the group to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: [Object[]] The group to look up in JIRA. This can be a String or a JiraPS.Group object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns information about the group "testGroup"
This example searches Active Directory for the username of John W. Smith, John H. Smith, and any other John Smiths, then obtains their JIRA user accounts.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns members of a given group in JIRA
This function returns members of a provided group in JIRA.

maml:Description.maml:para: Group object of which to display the members.
Index of the first user to return. This can be used to "page" through users in a large group or a slow connection.
Maximum number of results to return. By default, all users will be returned.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Group object of which to display the members.
Index of the first user to return. This can be used to "page" through users in a large group or a slow connection.
Maximum number of results to return. By default, all users will be returned.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.Group] The group to query for members

maml:alert.maml:para: By default, this will return all active users who are members of the given group. For large groups, this can take quite some time.
To limit the number of group members returned, use the MaxResults parameter. You can also combine this with the StartIndex parameter to "page" through results.
This function does not return inactive users. This appears to be a limitation of JIRA's REST API.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns all members of the JIRA group testGroup.
This example illustrates the use of the pipeline to return members of the Developers group in JIRA.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns information about an issue in JIRA.
This function obtains references to issues in JIRA.

This function can be used to directly query JIRA for a specific issue key or internal issue ID. It can also be used to query JIRA for issues matching a specific criteria using JQL (Jira Query Language).
For more details on JQL syntax, see this articla from Atlassian: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching
Output from this function can be piped to various other functions in this module, including Set-JiraIssue, Add-JiraIssueComment, and Invoke-JiraIssueTransition.

maml:Description.maml:para: Key of the issue to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Object of an issue to search for.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
JQL query for which to search for.
Index of the first issue to return. This can be used to "page" through issues in a large collection or a slow connection.
Maximum number of results to return. By default, all issues will be returned.

How many issues should be returned per call to JIRA. This parameter only has effect if $MaxResults is not provided or set to 0. Normally, you should not need to adjust this parameter, but if the REST calls take a long time, try playing with different values here.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Object of an existing JIRA filter from which the results will be returned.
Index of the first issue to return. This can be used to "page" through issues in a large collection or a slow connection.
Maximum number of results to return. By default, all issues will be returned.

How many issues should be returned per call to JIRA. This parameter only has effect if $MaxResults is not provided or set to 0. Normally, you should not need to adjust this parameter, but if the REST calls take a long time, try playing with different values here.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Key of the issue to search for.
Object of an issue to search for.
JQL query for which to search for.
Object of an existing JIRA filter from which the results will be returned.
Index of the first issue to return. This can be used to "page" through issues in a large collection or a slow connection.
Maximum number of results to return. By default, all issues will be returned.

How many issues should be returned per call to JIRA. This parameter only has effect if $MaxResults is not provided or set to 0. Normally, you should not need to adjust this parameter, but if the REST calls take a long time, try playing with different values here.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: This function can accept JiraPS.Issue objects, Strings, or Objects via the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: * If a JiraPS.Issue object is passed, this function returns a new reference to the same issue. * If a String is passed, this function searches for an issue with that issue key or internal ID. * If an Object is passed, this function invokes its ToString() method and treats it as a String.

dev:type.maml:name: This function outputs the JiraPS.Issue object retrieved.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns a reference to JIRA issue TEST-001.
This example illustrates pipeline use from Get-JiraIssue to Add-JiraIssueComment.
This example illustrates using the Query parameter and JQL syntax to query Jira for matching issues.
This example illustrates how to get an update of an issue from an old result of Get-JiraIssue stored in $oldIssue.
This example retrieves all issues that match the criteria in the saved fiilter with id 12345.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns comments on an issue in JIRA.
This function obtains comments from existing issues in JIRA.

maml:Description.maml:para: JIRA issue to check for comments. Can be a JiraPS.Issue object, issue key, or internal issue ID.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
JIRA issue to check for comments. Can be a JiraPS.Issue object, issue key, or internal issue ID.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

dev:type.maml:name: This function can accept JiraPS.Issue objects, Strings, or Objects via the pipeline. It uses Get-JiraIssue to identify the issue parameter; see its Inputs section for details on how this function handles inputs.
This function outputs all JiraPS.Comment issues associated with the provided issue.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example returns all comments posted to issue TEST-001.
This example illustrates use of the pipeline to return all comments on issue TEST-002.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns metadata required to create an issue in JIRA

This function returns metadata required to create an issue in JIRA - the fields that can be defined in the process of creating an issue. This can be used to identify custom fields in order to pass them to New-JiraIssue.

This function is particularly useful when your JIRA instance includes custom fields that are marked as mandatory. The required fields can be identified from this See the examples for more details on this approach.

maml:Description.maml:para: Project ID or key of the reference issue.
Issue type ID or name.
Path of the file with the configuration.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns metadata required to create an issue in JIRA

This function returns metadata required to create an issue in JIRA - the fields that can be defined in the process of creating an issue. This can be used to identify custom fields in order to pass them to New-JiraIssue.

This function is particularly useful when your JIRA instance includes custom fields that are marked as mandatory. The required fields can be identified from this See the examples for more details on this approach.

maml:description.maml:para: Performs an issue transition on a JIRA issue, changing its status

This function performs an issue transition on a JIRA issue. Transitions are defined in JIRA through workflows, and allow the issue to move from one status to the next. For example, the "Start Progress" transition typically moves an issue from an Open status to an "In Progress" status.

To identify the transitions that an issue can perform, use Get-JiraIssue and check the Transition property of the issue object returned. Attempting to perform a transition that does not apply to the issue (for example, trying to "start progress" on an issue in progress) will result in an exception.

maml:Description.maml:para: The Issue Object or ID to transition.
The Transition Object or ID.
Any additional fields that should be updated. Fields must be configured to appear on the transition screen to use this parameter.
New assignee of the issue. Enter 'Unassigned' to unassign the issue. Assignee field must be configured to appear on the transition screen to use this parameter.
Comment that should be added to JIRA. Comment field must be configured to appear on the transition screen to use this parameter.
Credentials to use to connect to Jira
The Issue Object or ID to transition.
The Transition Object or ID.
Any additional fields that should be updated. Fields must be configured to appear on the transition screen to use this parameter.
New assignee of the issue. Enter 'Unassigned' to unassign the issue. Assignee field must be configured to appear on the transition screen to use this parameter.
Comment that should be added to JIRA. Comment field must be configured to appear on the transition screen to use this parameter.
Credentials to use to connect to Jira

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.Issue] Issue (can also be provided as a String)

maml:description.maml:para: [JiraPS.Transition] Transition to perform (can also be provided as an int ID)

dev:type.maml:name: This function does not provide output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invokes transition ID 11 on issue TEST-01.
Invokes transition ID 11 on issue TEST-01 with a comment. Requires the comment field to be configured visible for transition.
Invokes transition ID 11 on issue TEST-01 and assigns to user 'Joe Blogs'. Requires the assignee field to be configured as visible for transition.

Invoke-JiraIssueTransition -Issue TEST-01 -Transition 11 -Fields $transitionFields Invokes transition ID 11 on issue TEST-01 and configures a custom field value. Requires fields to be configured as visible for transition.

Invoke-JiraIssueTransition -Issue TEST-01 -Transition $transition This example identifies the correct transition based on the result status of "In Progress," and invokes that transition on issue TEST-01.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an issue in JIRA
This function creates a new issue in JIRA.

Creating an issue requires a lot of data, and the exact data may be different from one instance of JIRA to the next. To identify what data is required for a given issue type and project, use the Get-JiraIssueCreateMetadata function provided in this module.

Some JIRA instances may require additional custom fields specific to that instance of JIRA. In addition to the parameterized fields provided in this function, the Fields parameter accepts a hashtable of field names / IDs and values. This allows users to provide custom field data when creating an issue.

maml:Description.maml:para: Project in which to create the issue.
Any additional fields.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Type of the issue.
ID of the Priority the issue shall have.
Summary of the issue.
Long description of the issue.
User that shall be registed as the reporter. If left empty, the currently authenticated user will be used.
List of labels which will be added to the issue.
Parent issue - in case of "Sub-Tasks".
Set the FixVersion of the issue.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Parent issue - in case of "Sub-Tasks".
Set the FixVersion of the issue.
Any additional fields.

Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: This function does not accept pipeline input.

dev:remarks.maml:para: New-JiraIssue -Project TEST -IssueType Bug -Priority 1 -Summary 'Test issue from PowerShell' -Description 'This is a test issue created from the JiraPS module in PowerShell.' -Fields {'Custom Field Name 1'='foo';'customfield_10001'='bar';} This example uses Get-JiraIssueCreateMetadata to identify fields required to create an issue in JIRA. It then creates an issue with the Fields parameter providing a field name and a field ID.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a persistent JIRA authenticated session which can be used by other JiraPS functions

This function creates a persistent, authenticated session in to JIRA which can be used by all other JiraPS functions instead of explicitly passing parameters. This removes the need to use the -Credential parameter constantly for each function call.
This is the equivalent of a browser cookie saving login information.
Session data is stored in this module's PrivateData; it is not necessary to supply it to each subsequent function.

maml:Description.maml:para: Credentials to use to connect to JIRA.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a persistent JIRA authenticated session
This function removes a persistent JIRA authenticated session and closes the session for JIRA. This can be used to "log out" of JIRA once work is complete.
If called with the Session parameter, this function will attempt to close the provided JiraPS.Session object.
If called with no parameters, this function will close the saved JIRA session in the module's PrivateData.

maml:description.maml:para: Defines the configured URL for the JIRA server
This function defines the configured URL for the JIRA server that JiraPS should manipulate. By default, this is stored in a config.xml file at the module's root path.

maml:Description.maml:para: The base URL of the Jira instance.
Path where the file with the configuration will be stored.
The base URL of the Jira instance.
Path where the file with the configuration will be stored.

dev:type.maml:name: This function does not accept pipeline input.

maml:alert.maml:para: Support for multiple configuration files is limited at this point in time, but enhancements are planned for a future update.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example defines the server URL of the JIRA server configured in the JiraPS config file.
This example defines the server URL of the JIRA server configured at C:\jiraconfig.xml.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an existing issue in JIRA
This function modifies an existing isue in JIRA. This can include changing the issue's summary or description, or assigning the issue.

maml:Description.maml:para: Issue key or JiraPS.Issue object returned from Get-JiraIssue
New summary of the issue.
New description of the issue.
Set the FixVersion of the issue, this will overwrite any present FixVersions
New assignee of the issue. Enter 'Unassigned' to unassign the issue.
Labels to be set on the issue. These wil overwrite any existing labels on the issue. For more granular control over issue labels, use Set-JiraIssueLabel.
Any additional fields that should be updated.
Path of the file where the configuration is stored.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Issue key or JiraPS.Issue object returned from Get-JiraIssue
New summary of the issue.
New description of the issue.
Set the FixVersion of the issue, this will overwrite any present FixVersions
New assignee of the issue. Enter 'Unassigned' to unassign the issue.
Labels to be set on the issue. These wil overwrite any existing labels on the issue. For more granular control over issue labels, use Set-JiraIssueLabel.
Any additional fields that should be updated.
Path of the file where the configuration is stored.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.Issue[]] The JIRA issue that should be modified
If the -PassThru parameter is provided, this function will provide a reference

maml:description.maml:para: to the JIRA issue modified. Otherwise, this function does not provide output.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Set-JiraIssue -Issue TEST-01 -Summary 'Modified issue summary' -Description 'This issue has been modified by PowerShell'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example changes the summary and description of the JIRA issue TEST-01.

$issue | Set-JiraIssue -Description "$($issue.Description)`n`nEdit: Also foo." This example appends text to the end of an existing issue description by using Get-JiraIssue to obtain a reference to the current issue and description.
This example removes the assignee from JIRA issue TEST-01.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies labels on an existing JIRA issue
This function modifies labels on an existing JIRA issue. There are four supported operations on labels:
* Add: appends additional labels to the labels that an issue already has
* Remove: Removes labels from an issue's current labels
* Set: erases the existing labels on the issue and replaces them with
the provided values * Clear: removes all labels from the issue

maml:Description.maml:para: Issue key or JiraPS.Issue object returned from Get-JiraIssue
List of labels that will be set to the issue. Any label that was already assigned to the issue will be removed.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Existing labels to be added.
Existing labels to be removed.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Issue key or JiraPS.Issue object returned from Get-JiraIssue
Remove all labels.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.

Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.Issue[]] The JIRA issue that should be modified
If the -PassThru parameter is provided, this function will provide a reference

maml:description.maml:para: to the JIRA issue modified. Otherwise, this function does not provide output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example replaces all existing labels on issue TEST-01 with one label, "fixed".
This example adds the "enhancement" label to all issues matching the JQL - in this case, all issues created by user joeSmith in the last 7 days.
This example removes all labels from the issue TEST-01.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies user properties in JIRA
This function modifies user properties in JIRA, allowing you to change a user's e-mail address, display name, and any other properties supported by JIRA's API.

maml:Description.maml:para: Username or user object obtained from Get-JiraUser.
Display name to set.
E-mail address to set.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Username or user object obtained from Get-JiraUser.
Hashtable (dictionary) of additional information to set.
Credentials to use to connect to JIRA. If not specified, this function will use anonymous access.
Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Username or user object obtained from Get-JiraUser.
Display name to set.
E-mail address to set.

Whether output should be provided after invoking this function.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: [JiraPS.User[]] The JIRA user that should be modified.
If the -PassThru parameter is provided, this function will provide a reference

maml:description.maml:para: to the JIRA user modified. Otherwise, this function does not provide output.

maml:alert.maml:para: It is currently NOT possible to enable and disable users with this function. JIRA does not currently provide this ability via their REST API.
If you'd like to see this ability added to JIRA and to this module, please vote on Atlassian's site for this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37294

dev:remarks.maml:para: Modifies user1's e-mail address to a new value. The original value is overridden.
This example modifies a user's properties using a hashtable. This allows updating properties that are not exposed as parameters to this function.

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an existing Version in JIRA
This function modifies the Version for an existing Project in JIRA.

maml:Description.maml:para: Version to be changed
New Name of the Version.
New Description of the Version.
New value for Archived.
New value for Released.
New Date of the release.
New Date of the user release.
The new Project where this version should be in. This can be the ID of the Project, or the Project Object
Credentials to use to connect to Jira.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Version to be changed
New Name of the Version.
New Description of the Version.
New value for Archived.
New value for Released.
New Date of the release.
New Date of the user release.
The new Project where this version should be in. This can be the ID of the Project, or the Project Object
Credentials to use to connect to Jira.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function requires either the -Credential parameter to be passed or a persistent JIRA session. See New-JiraSession for more details. If neither are supplied, this function will run with anonymous access to JIRA.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example assigns the modifies the existing version with a new name 'New-Name'.
This example assigns the modifies the existing version with a new name 'New-Name'.
